children.text: This model is designed to assist in the selection of an investment portfolio featuring a risk-free asset and two of the biggest stocks traded on US stock exchange markets.

The 10-year Treasury Bond was employed as a source for the market data of the risk-free rate, and the return and volatility of each stock were determined by analyzing the historic prices for the past 5 years.
Please enter the total amount you are willing to invest.
What percentage of your investment portfolio would you like to maintain in a risk-free rate asset?
You can select two stocks from the following lists to form a risky portfolio.
you would like to acquire. The remainder will be allotted to

The Sharp Ratio of this investment portfolio is
. An investor should always strive for the highest possible Sharp Ratio. By doing so, the investor would be able to obtain the highest possible return with a minimized level of volatility.
In the table and graph below, you can see how your expected return from your investments assuming you are able to re-invest the interests you receive every year.
